can_edit_stories.description: True, if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users, post stories to the chat page, pin chat stories, and access the chat's story archive

can_delete_stories.description: True, if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users

can_post_messages.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post messages in the channel, approve suggested posts, or access channel statistics; for channels only

can_edit_messages.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only

can_pin_messages.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; for groups and supergroups only

can_manage_topics.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only

can_manage_direct_messages.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can manage direct messages of the channel and decline suggested posts; for channels only

custom_title.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

ChatMemberMember.title: ChatMemberMember
ChatMemberMember.description: Represents a chat member that has no additional privileges or restrictions.

status.description: The member's status in the chat, always "member"

until_date.description: Optional. Date when the user's subscription will expire; Unix time

ChatMemberRestricted.title: ChatMemberRestricted
ChatMemberRestricted.description: Represents a chat member that is under certain restrictions in the chat. Supergroups only.

status.description: The member's status in the chat, always "restricted"

is_member.description: True, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

can_send_messages.description: True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, giveaways, giveaway winners, invoices, locations and venues

can_send_audios.description: True, if the user is allowed to send audios

can_send_documents.description: True, if the user is allowed to send documents

can_send_photos.description: True, if the user is allowed to send photos

can_send_videos.description: True, if the user is allowed to send videos

can_send_video_notes.description: True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

can_send_voice_notes.description: True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

can_send_polls.description: True, if the user is allowed to send polls and checklists

can_send_other_messages.description: True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

can_add_web_page_previews.description: True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

can_change_info.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

can_invite_users.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

can_pin_messages.description: True, if the user is allowed to pin messages

can_manage_topics.description: True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics

until_date.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; Unix time. If 0, then the user is restricted forever

ChatMemberLeft.title: ChatMemberLeft
ChatMemberLeft.description: Represents a chat member that isn't currently a member of the chat, but may join it themselves.

status.description: The member's status in the chat, always "left"

ChatMemberBanned.title: ChatMemberBanned
ChatMemberBanned.description: Represents a chat member that was banned in the chat and can't return to the chat or view chat messages.

status.description: The member's status in the chat, always "kicked"

until_date.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; Unix time. If 0, then the user is banned forever

ChatJoinRequest.title: ChatJoinRequest
ChatJoinRequest.description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

chat.description: Chat to which the request was sent

from.description: User that sent the join request

user_chat_id.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 5 minutes to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.

date.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time

invite_link.description: Optional. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request

ChatPermissions.title: ChatPermissions
ChatPermissions.description: Describes actions that a non-administrator user is allowed to take in a chat.

can_send_messages.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, giveaways, giveaway winners, invoices, locations and venues

can_send_audios.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send audios

can_send_documents.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send documents

can_send_photos.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send photos

can_send_videos.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send videos

can_send_video_notes.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

can_send_voice_notes.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

can_send_polls.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send polls and checklists

can_send_other_messages.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

can_add_web_page_previews.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

can_change_info.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings. Ignored in public supergroups

can_invite_users.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

can_pin_messages.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages. Ignored in public supergroups

can_manage_topics.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics. If omitted defaults to the value of can_pin_messages

Birthdate.title: Birthdate
Birthdate.description: Describes the birthdate of a user.

year.description: Optional. Year of the user's birth

BusinessIntro.title: BusinessIntro
BusinessIntro.description: Contains information about the start page settings of a Telegram Business account.

title.description: Optional. Title text of the business intro

message.description: Optional. Message text of the business intro

sticker.description: Optional. Sticker of the business intro

BusinessLocation.title: BusinessLocation
BusinessLocation.description: Contains information about the location of a Telegram Business account.

BusinessOpeningHoursInterval.title: BusinessOpeningHoursInterval
BusinessOpeningHoursInterval.description: Describes an interval of time during which a business is open.

opening_minute.description: The minute's sequence number in a week, starting on Monday, marking the start of the time interval during which the business is open; 0 - 7 * 24 * 60

closing_minute.description: The minute's sequence number in a week, starting on Monday, marking the end of the time interval during which the business is open; 0 - 8 * 24 * 60

BusinessOpeningHours.title: BusinessOpeningHours
BusinessOpeningHours.description: Describes the opening hours of a business.

time_zone_name.description: Unique name of the time zone for which the opening hours are defined

opening_hours.description: List of time intervals describing business opening hours

StoryAreaPosition.title: StoryAreaPosition
StoryAreaPosition.description: Describes the position of a clickable area within a story.

x_percentage.description: The abscissa of the area's center, as a percentage of the media width

y_percentage.description: The ordinate of the area's center, as a percentage of the media height

width_percentage.description: The width of the area's rectangle, as a percentage of the media width

height_percentage.description: The height of the area's rectangle, as a percentage of the media height

rotation_angle.description: The clockwise rotation angle of the rectangle, in degrees; 0-360

corner_radius_percentage.description: The radius of the rectangle corner rounding, as a percentage of the media width

LocationAddress.title: LocationAddress
LocationAddress.description: Describes the physical address of a location.

country_code.description: The two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the country where the location is located

street.description: Optional. Street address of the location

StoryAreaType.title: StoryAreaType
StoryAreaType.description:
Describes the type of a clickable area on a story. Currently, it can be one of
- StoryAreaTypeLocation
- StoryAreaTypeSuggestedReaction
- StoryAreaTypeLink
- StoryAreaTypeWeather
- StoryAreaTypeUniqueGift

StoryAreaTypeLocation.title: StoryAreaTypeLocation
StoryAreaTypeLocation.description: Describes a story area pointing to a location. Currently, a story can have up to 10 location areas.

type.description: Type of the area, always "location"

StoryAreaTypeSuggestedReaction.title: StoryAreaTypeSuggestedReaction
StoryAreaTypeSuggestedReaction.description: Describes a story area pointing to a suggested reaction. Currently, a story can have up to 5 suggested reaction areas.

type.description: Type of the area, always "suggested_reaction"

is_dark.description: Optional. Pass True if the reaction area has a dark background

is_flipped.description: Optional. Pass True if reaction area corner is flipped

StoryAreaTypeLink.title: StoryAreaTypeLink
StoryAreaTypeLink.description: Describes a story area pointing to an HTTP or tg:// link. Currently, a story can have up to 3 link areas.

type.description: Type of the area, always "link"

url.description: HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the area is clicked

StoryAreaTypeWeather.title: StoryAreaTypeWeather
StoryAreaTypeWeather.description: Describes a story area containing weather information. Currently, a story can have up to 3 weather areas.

type.description: Type of the area, always "weather"

background_color.description: A color of the area background in the ARGB format

StoryAreaTypeUniqueGift.title: StoryAreaTypeUniqueGift
StoryAreaTypeUniqueGift.description: Describes a story area pointing to a unique gift. Currently, a story can have at most 1 unique gift area.

type.description: Type of the area, always "unique_gift"

StoryArea.title: StoryArea
StoryArea.description: Describes a clickable area on a story media.

type.description: Type of the area

ChatLocation.title: ChatLocation
ChatLocation.description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected.

location.description: The location to which the supergroup is connected. Can't be a live location.

address.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

ReactionType.title: ReactionType
ReactionType.description:
This object describes the type of a reaction. Currently, it can be one of
- ReactionTypeEmoji
- ReactionTypeCustomEmoji
- ReactionTypePaid

ReactionTypeEmoji.title: ReactionTypeEmoji
ReactionTypeEmoji.description: The reaction is based on an emoji.

type.description: Type of the reaction, always "emoji"

ReactionTypeCustomEmoji.title: ReactionTypeCustomEmoji
ReactionTypeCustomEmoji.description: The reaction is based on a custom emoji.

type.description: Type of the reaction, always "custom_emoji"
Type of the reaction, always "paid"

ReactionCount.title: ReactionCount
ReactionCount.description: Represents a reaction added to a message along with the number of times it was added.

type.description: Type of the reaction

total_count.description: Number of times the reaction was added

MessageReactionUpdated.title: MessageReactionUpdated
MessageReactionUpdated.description: This object represents a change of a reaction on a message performed by a user.

chat.description: The chat containing the message the user reacted to

message_id.description: Unique identifier of the message inside the chat

user.description: Optional. The user that changed the reaction, if the user isn't anonymous

actor_chat.description: Optional. The chat on behalf of which the reaction was changed, if the user is anonymous

date.description: Date of the change in Unix time

old_reaction.description: Previous list of reaction types that were set by the user

new_reaction.description: New list of reaction types that have been set by the user

MessageReactionCountUpdated.title: MessageReactionCountUpdated
MessageReactionCountUpdated.description: This object represents reaction changes on a message with anonymous reactions.

message_id.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

date.description: Date of the change in Unix time

reactions.description: List of reactions that are present on the message

ForumTopic.title: ForumTopic
ForumTopic.description: This object represents a forum topic.

message_thread_id.description: Unique identifier of the forum topic

icon_color.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

icon_custom_emoji_id.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

Gift.title: Gift
Gift.description: This object represents a gift that can be sent by the bot.

id.description: Unique identifier of the gift

sticker.description: The sticker that represents the gift

star_count.description: The number of Telegram Stars that must be paid to send the sticker

upgrade_star_count.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars that must be paid to upgrade the gift to a unique one

total_count.description: Optional. The total number of the gifts of this type that can be sent; for limited gifts only

remaining_count.description: Optional. The number of remaining gifts of this type that can be sent; for limited gifts only

publisher_chat.description: Optional. Information about the chat that published the gift

Gifts.title: Gifts
Gifts.description: This object represent a list of gifts.

UniqueGiftModel.title: UniqueGiftModel
UniqueGiftModel.description: This object describes the model of a unique gift.

sticker.description: The sticker that represents the unique gift

rarity_per_mille.description: The number of unique gifts that receive this model for every 1000 gifts upgraded

UniqueGiftSymbol.title: UniqueGiftSymbol
UniqueGiftSymbol.description: This object describes the symbol shown on the pattern of a unique gift.

sticker.description: The sticker that represents the unique gift

rarity_per_mille.description: The number of unique gifts that receive this model for every 1000 gifts upgraded

UniqueGiftBackdropColors.title: UniqueGiftBackdropColors
UniqueGiftBackdropColors.description: This object describes the colors of the backdrop of a unique gift.

center_color.description: The color in the center of the backdrop in RGB format

edge_color.description: The color on the edges of the backdrop in RGB format

symbol_color.description: The color to be applied to the symbol in RGB format

text_color.description: The color for the text on the backdrop in RGB format

UniqueGiftBackdrop.title: UniqueGiftBackdrop
UniqueGiftBackdrop.description: This object describes the backdrop of a unique gift.

rarity_per_mille.description: The number of unique gifts that receive this backdrop for every 1000 gifts upgraded

UniqueGift.title: UniqueGift
UniqueGift.description: This object describes a unique gift that was upgraded from a regular gift.

base_name.description: Human-readable name of the regular gift from which this unique gift was upgraded

name.description: Unique name of the gift. This name can be used in https://t.me/nft/... links and story areas

number.description: Unique number of the upgraded gift among gifts upgraded from the same regular gift

publisher_chat.description: Optional. Information about the chat that published the gift

GiftInfo.title: GiftInfo
GiftInfo.description: Describes a service message about a regular gift that was sent or received.

owned_gift_id.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the received gift for the bot; only present for gifts received on behalf of business accounts

convert_star_count.description: Optional. Number of Telegram Stars that can be claimed by the receiver by converting the gift; omitted if conversion to Telegram Stars is impossible

prepaid_upgrade_star_count.description: Optional. Number of Telegram Stars that were prepaid by the sender for the ability to upgrade the gift

can_be_upgraded.description: Optional. True, if the gift can be upgraded to a unique gift

text.description: Optional. Text of the message that was added to the gift

entities.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in the text

is_private.description: Optional. True, if the sender and gift text are shown only to the gift receiver; otherwise, everyone will be able to see them

UniqueGiftInfo.title: UniqueGiftInfo
UniqueGiftInfo.description: Describes a service message about a unique gift that was sent or received.

origin.description: Origin of the gift. Currently, either "upgrade" for gifts upgraded from regular gifts, "transfer" for gifts transferred from other users or channels, or "resale" for gifts bought from other users

last_resale_star_count.description: Optional. For gifts bought from other users, the price paid for the gift

owned_gift_id.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the received gift for the bot; only present for gifts received on behalf of business accounts

transfer_star_count.description: Optional. Number of Telegram Stars that must be paid to transfer the gift; omitted if the bot cannot transfer the gift

next_transfer_date.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the gift can be transferred. If it is in the past, then the gift can be transferred now

OwnedGift.title: OwnedGift
OwnedGift.description:
This object describes a gift received and owned by a user or a chat. Currently, it can be one of
- OwnedGiftRegular
- OwnedGiftUnique

OwnedGiftRegular.title: OwnedGiftRegular
OwnedGiftRegular.description: Describes a regular gift owned by a user or a chat.

type.description: Type of the gift, always "regular"

owned_gift_id.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the gift for the bot; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

sender_user.description: Optional. Sender of the gift if it is a known user

send_date.description: Date the gift was sent in Unix time

text.description: Optional. Text of the message that was added to the gift

entities.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in the text

is_private.description: Optional. True, if the sender and gift text are shown only to the gift receiver; otherwise, everyone will be able to see them

is_saved.description: Optional. True, if the gift is displayed on the account's profile page; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

can_be_upgraded.description: Optional. True, if the gift can be upgraded to a unique gift; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

was_refunded.description: Optional. True, if the gift was refunded and isn't available anymore

convert_star_count.description: Optional. Number of Telegram Stars that can be claimed by the receiver instead of the gift; omitted if the gift cannot be converted to Telegram Stars

prepaid_upgrade_star_count.description: Optional. Number of Telegram Stars that were paid by the sender for the ability to upgrade the gift

OwnedGiftUnique.title: OwnedGiftUnique
OwnedGiftUnique.description: Describes a unique gift received and owned by a user or a chat.

type.description: Type of the gift, always "unique"

owned_gift_id.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the received gift for the bot; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

sender_user.description: Optional. Sender of the gift if it is a known user

send_date.description: Date the gift was sent in Unix time

is_saved.description: Optional. True, if the gift is displayed on the account's profile page; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

can_be_transferred.description: Optional. True, if the gift can be transferred to another owner; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

transfer_star_count.description: Optional. Number of Telegram Stars that must be paid to transfer the gift; omitted if the bot cannot transfer the gift

next_transfer_date.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the gift can be transferred. If it is in the past, then the gift can be transferred now

OwnedGifts.title: OwnedGifts
OwnedGifts.description: Contains the list of gifts received and owned by a user or a chat.

total_count.description: The total number of gifts owned by the user or the chat

next_offset.description: Optional. Offset for the next request. If empty, then there are no more results

AcceptedGiftTypes.title: AcceptedGiftTypes
AcceptedGiftTypes.description: This object describes the types of gifts that can be gifted to a user or a chat.

unlimited_gifts.description: True, if unlimited regular gifts are accepted

limited_gifts.description: True, if limited regular gifts are accepted

unique_gifts.description: True, if unique gifts or gifts that can be upgraded to unique for free are accepted

premium_subscription.description: True, if a Telegram Premium subscription is accepted

StarAmount.title: StarAmount
StarAmount.description: Describes an amount of Telegram Stars.

amount.description: Integer amount of Telegram Stars, rounded to 0; can be negative

nanostar_amount.description: Optional. The number of 1/1000000000 shares of Telegram Stars; from -999999999 to 999999999; can be negative if and only if amount is non-positive

BotCommand.title: BotCommand
BotCommand.description: This object represents a bot command.

command.description: Text of the command; 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.

BotCommandScope.title: BotCommandScope
BotCommandScope.description:
This object represents the scope to which bot commands are applied. Currently, the following 7 scopes are supported:
- BotCommandScopeDefault
- BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
- BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
- BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
- BotCommandScopeChat
- BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
- BotCommandScopeChatMember

BotCommandScopeDefault.title: BotCommandScopeDefault
BotCommandScopeDefault.description: Represents the default scope of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a narrower scope are specified for the user.

type.description: Scope type, must be default

BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats.title: BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all private chats.

type.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats

BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats.title: BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

type.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats

BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators.title: BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

type.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators

BotCommandScopeChat.title: BotCommandScopeChat
BotCommandScopeChat.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

type.description: Scope type, must be chat

chat_id.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername). Channel direct messages chats and channel chats aren't supported.

BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators.title: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all administrators of a specific group or supergroup chat.

type.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators

chat_id.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername). Channel direct messages chats and channel chats aren't supported.

BotCommandScopeChatMember.title: BotCommandScopeChatMember
BotCommandScopeChatMember.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific member of a group or supergroup chat.

type.description: Scope type, must be chat_member

chat_id.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername). Channel direct messages chats and channel chats aren't supported.

user_id.description: Unique identifier of the target user

BotName.title: BotName
BotName.description: This object represents the bot's name.

BotDescription.title: BotDescription
BotDescription.description: This object represents the bot's description.

BotShortDescription.title: BotShortDescription
BotShortDescription.description: This object represents the bot's short description.

MenuButton.title: MenuButton
MenuButton.description:
This object describes the bot's menu button in a private chat. It should be one of
- MenuButtonCommands
- MenuButtonWebApp
- MenuButtonDefault
If a menu button other than MenuButtonDefault is set for a private chat, then it is applied in the chat. Otherwise the default menu button is applied. By default, the menu button opens the list of bot commands.

MenuButtonCommands.title: MenuButtonCommands
MenuButtonCommands.description: Represents a menu button, which opens the bot's list of commands.

type.description: Type of the button, must be commands

MenuButtonWebApp.title: MenuButtonWebApp
MenuButtonWebApp.description: Represents a menu button, which launches a Web App.

type.description: Type of the button, must be web_app

web_app.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Alternatively, a t.me link to a Web App of the bot can be specified in the object instead of the Web App's URL, in which case the Web App will be opened as if the user pressed the link.

MenuButtonDefault.title: MenuButtonDefault
MenuButtonDefault.description: Describes that no specific value for the menu button was set.

type.description: Type of the button, must be default

ChatBoostSource.title: ChatBoostSource
ChatBoostSource.description:
This object describes the source of a chat boost. It can be one of
- ChatBoostSourcePremium
- ChatBoostSourceGiftCode
- ChatBoostSourceGiveaway

ChatBoostSourcePremium.title: ChatBoostSourcePremium
ChatBoostSourcePremium.description: The boost was obtained by subscribing to Telegram Premium or by gifting a Telegram Premium subscription to another user.

ChatBoostSourceGiftCode.title: ChatBoostSourceGiftCode
ChatBoostSourceGiftCode.description: The boost was obtained by the creation of Telegram Premium gift codes to boost a chat. Each such code boosts the chat 4 times for the duration of the corresponding Telegram Premium subscription.

user.description: User for which the gift code was created

ChatBoostSourceGiveaway.title: ChatBoostSourceGiveaway
ChatBoostSourceGiveaway.description: The boost was obtained by the creation of a Telegram Premium or a Telegram Star giveaway. This boosts the chat 4 times for the duration of the corresponding Telegram Premium subscription for Telegram Premium giveaways and prize_star_count / 500 times for one year for Telegram Star giveaways.

giveaway_message_id.description: Identifier of a message in the chat with the giveaway; the message could have been deleted already. May be 0 if the message isn't sent yet.

user.description: Optional. User that won the prize in the giveaway if any; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

prize_star_count.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

is_unclaimed.description: Optional. True, if the giveaway was completed, but there was no user to win the prize

ChatBoost.title: ChatBoost
ChatBoost.description: This object contains information about a chat boost.

add_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the chat was boosted

expiration_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost will automatically expire, unless the booster's Telegram Premium subscription is prolonged

ChatBoostUpdated.title: ChatBoostUpdated
ChatBoostUpdated.description: This object represents a boost added to a chat or changed.

ChatBoostRemoved.title: ChatBoostRemoved
ChatBoostRemoved.description: This object represents a boost removed from a chat.

remove_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost was removed

UserChatBoosts.title: UserChatBoosts
UserChatBoosts.description: This object represents a list of boosts added to a chat by a user.

boosts.description: The list of boosts added to the chat by the user

BusinessBotRights.title: BusinessBotRights
BusinessBotRights.description: Represents the rights of a business bot.

can_reply.description: Optional. True, if the bot can send and edit messages in the private chats that had incoming messages in the last 24 hours

can_read_messages.description: Optional. True, if the bot can mark incoming private messages as read

can_delete_sent_messages.description: Optional. True, if the bot can delete messages sent by the bot

can_delete_all_messages.description: Optional. True, if the bot can delete all private messages in managed chats

can_edit_name.description: Optional. True, if the bot can edit the first and last name of the business account

can_edit_bio.description: Optional. True, if the bot can edit the bio of the business account

can_edit_profile_photo.description: Optional. True, if the bot can edit the profile photo of the business account

can_edit_username.description: Optional. True, if the bot can edit the username of the business account

can_change_gift_settings.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the privacy settings pertaining to gifts for the business account

can_view_gifts_and_stars.description: Optional. True, if the bot can view gifts and the amount of Telegram Stars owned by the business account

can_convert_gifts_to_stars.description: Optional. True, if the bot can convert regular gifts owned by the business account to Telegram Stars

can_transfer_and_upgrade_gifts.description: Optional. True, if the bot can transfer and upgrade gifts owned by the business account

can_transfer_stars.description: Optional. True, if the bot can transfer Telegram Stars received by the business account to its own account, or use them to upgrade and transfer gifts

can_manage_stories.description: Optional. True, if the bot can post, edit and delete stories on behalf of the business account

BusinessConnection.title: BusinessConnection
BusinessConnection.description: Describes the connection of the bot with a business account.

id.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

user.description: Business account user that created the business connection

user_chat_id.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who created the business connection. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

date.description: Date the connection was established in Unix time

rights.description: Optional. Rights of the business bot

is_enabled.description: True, if the connection is active

BusinessMessagesDeleted.title: BusinessMessagesDeleted
BusinessMessagesDeleted.description: This object is received when messages are deleted from a connected business account.

business_connection_id.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

chat.description: Information about a chat in the business account. The bot may not have access to the chat or the corresponding user.

message_ids.description: The list of identifiers of deleted messages in the chat of the business account

ResponseParameters.title: ResponseParameters
ResponseParameters.description: Describes why a request was unsuccessful.

migrate_to_chat_id.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

retry_after.description: Optional. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

InputMedia.title: InputMedia
InputMedia.description:
This object represents the content of a media message to be sent. It should be one of
- InputMediaAnimation
- InputMediaDocument
- InputMediaAudio
- InputMediaPhoto
- InputMediaVideo

InputMediaPhoto.title: InputMediaPhoto
InputMediaPhoto.description: Represents a photo to be sent.

type.description: Type of the result, must be photo

media.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

has_spoiler.description: Optional. Pass True if the photo needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

InputMediaVideo.title: InputMediaVideo
InputMediaVideo.description: Represents a video to be sent.

type.description: Type of the result, must be video

media.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

thumbnail.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

cover.description: Optional. Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

start_timestamp.description: Optional. Start timestamp for the video in the message

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

supports_streaming.description: Optional. Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming

has_spoiler.description: Optional. Pass True if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

InputMediaAnimation.title: InputMediaAnimation
InputMediaAnimation.description: Represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound) to be sent.

type.description: Type of the result, must be animation

media.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

thumbnail.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the animation to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the animation caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

has_spoiler.description: Optional. Pass True if the animation needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

InputMediaAudio.title: InputMediaAudio
InputMediaAudio.description: Represents an audio file to be treated as music to be sent.

type.description: Type of the result, must be audio

media.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

thumbnail.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the audio to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

duration.description: Optional. Duration of the audio in seconds

InputMediaDocument.title: InputMediaDocument
InputMediaDocument.description: Represents a general file to be sent.

type.description: Type of the result, must be document

media.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

thumbnail.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

disable_content_type_detection.description: Optional. Disables automatic server-side content type detection for files uploaded using multipart/form-data. Always True, if the document is sent as part of an album.

InputFile.title: InputFile
InputFile.description: This object represents the contents of a file to be uploaded. Must be posted using multipart/form-data in the usual way that files are uploaded via the browser.

InputPaidMedia.title: InputPaidMedia
InputPaidMedia.description:
This object describes the paid media to be sent. Currently, it can be one of
- InputPaidMediaPhoto
- InputPaidMediaVideo

InputPaidMediaPhoto.title: InputPaidMediaPhoto
InputPaidMediaPhoto.description: The paid media to send is a photo.

type.description: Type of the media, must be photo

media.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

InputPaidMediaVideo.title: InputPaidMediaVideo
InputPaidMediaVideo.description: The paid media to send is a video.

type.description: Type of the media, must be video

media.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

thumbnail.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

cover.description: Optional. Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

start_timestamp.description: Optional. Start timestamp for the video in the message

supports_streaming.description: Optional. Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming

InputProfilePhoto.title: InputProfilePhoto
InputProfilePhoto.description:
This object describes a profile photo to set. Currently, it can be one of
- InputProfilePhotoStatic
- InputProfilePhotoAnimated

InputProfilePhotoStatic.title: InputProfilePhotoStatic
InputProfilePhotoStatic.description: A static profile photo in the .JPG format.

type.description: Type of the profile photo, must be static

photo.description: The static profile photo. Profile photos can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

InputProfilePhotoAnimated.title: InputProfilePhotoAnimated
InputProfilePhotoAnimated.description: An animated profile photo in the MPEG4 format.

type.description: Type of the profile photo, must be animated

animation.description: The animated profile photo. Profile photos can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

main_frame_timestamp.description: Optional. Timestamp in seconds of the frame that will be used as the static profile photo. Defaults to 0.0.

InputStoryContent.title: InputStoryContent
InputStoryContent.description:
This object describes the content of a story to post. Currently, it can be one of
- InputStoryContentPhoto
- InputStoryContentVideo

InputStoryContentPhoto.title: InputStoryContentPhoto
InputStoryContentPhoto.description: Describes a photo to post as a story.

type.description: Type of the content, must be photo

photo.description: The photo to post as a story. The photo must be of the size 1080x1920 and must not exceed 10 MB. The photo can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

InputStoryContentVideo.title: InputStoryContentVideo
InputStoryContentVideo.description: Describes a video to post as a story.

type.description: Type of the content, must be video

video.description: The video to post as a story. The video must be of the size 720x1280, streamable, encoded with H.265 codec, with key frames added each second in the MPEG4 format, and must not exceed 30 MB. The video can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the video was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

duration.description: Optional. Precise duration of the video in seconds; 0-60

cover_frame_timestamp.description: Optional. Timestamp in seconds of the frame that will be used as the static cover for the story. Defaults to 0.0.

is_animation.description: Optional. Pass True if the video has no sound

file_id.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

file_unique_id.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

type.description: Type of the sticker, currently one of "regular", "mask", "custom_emoji". The type of the sticker is independent from its format, which is determined by the fields is_animated and is_video.

is_animated.description: True, if the sticker is animated

is_video.description: True, if the sticker is a video sticker

thumbnail.description: Optional. Sticker thumbnail in the .WEBP or .JPG format

emoji.description: Optional. Emoji associated with the sticker

set_name.description: Optional. Name of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs

premium_animation.description: Optional. For premium regular stickers, premium animation for the sticker

mask_position.description: Optional. For mask stickers, the position where the mask should be placed

custom_emoji_id.description: Optional. For custom emoji stickers, unique identifier of the custom emoji

needs_repainting.description: Optional. True, if the sticker must be repainted to a text color in messages, the color of the Telegram Premium badge in emoji status, white color on chat photos, or another appropriate color in other places

StickerSet.title: StickerSet
StickerSet.description: This object represents a sticker set.

sticker_type.description: Type of stickers in the set, currently one of "regular", "mask", "custom_emoji"

thumbnail.description: Optional. Sticker set thumbnail in the .WEBP, .TGS, or .WEBM format

MaskPosition.title: MaskPosition
MaskPosition.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

point.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of "forehead", "eyes", "mouth", or "chin".

x_shift.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

y_shift.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

scale.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

InputSticker.title: InputSticker
InputSticker.description: This object describes a sticker to be added to a sticker set.

sticker.description: The added sticker. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new file using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. Animated and video stickers can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

format.description: Format of the added sticker, must be one of "static" for a .WEBP or .PNG image, "animated" for a .TGS animation, "video" for a .WEBM video

emoji_list.description: List of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

mask_position.description: Optional. Position where the mask should be placed on faces. For "mask" stickers only.

keywords.description: Optional. List of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters. For "regular" and "custom_emoji" stickers only.

InlineQuery.title: InlineQuery
InlineQuery.description: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

id.description: Unique identifier for this query

query.description: Text of the query (up to 256 characters)

offset.description: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot

chat_type.description: Optional. Type of the chat from which the inline query was sent. Can be either "sender" for a private chat with the inline query sender, "private", "group", "supergroup", or "channel". The chat type should be always known for requests sent from official clients and most third-party clients, unless the request was sent from a secret chat

location.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that request user location

InlineQueryResultsButton.title: InlineQueryResultsButton
InlineQueryResultsButton.description: This object represents a button to be shown above inline query results. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

web_app.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to switch back to the inline mode using the method switchInlineQuery inside the Web App.

start_parameter.description: Optional. Deep-linking parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when a user presses the button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed. Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an OAuth link. Once done, the bot can offer a switch_inline button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.

InlineQueryResult.title: InlineQueryResult
InlineQueryResult.description:
This object represents one result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support results of the following 20 types:
- InlineQueryResultCachedAudio
- InlineQueryResultCachedDocument
- InlineQueryResultCachedGif
- InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif
- InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto
- InlineQueryResultCachedSticker
- InlineQueryResultCachedVideo
- InlineQueryResultCachedVoice
- InlineQueryResultArticle
- InlineQueryResultAudio
- InlineQueryResultContact
- InlineQueryResultGame
- InlineQueryResultDocument
- InlineQueryResultGif
- InlineQueryResultLocation
- InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif
- InlineQueryResultPhoto
- InlineQueryResultVenue
- InlineQueryResultVideo
- InlineQueryResultVoice
Note: All URLs passed in inline query results will be available to end users and therefore must be assumed to be public.

InlineQueryResultArticle.title: InlineQueryResultArticle
InlineQueryResultArticle.description: Represents a link to an article or web page.

type.description: Type of the result, must be article

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

input_message_content.description: Content of the message to be sent

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

description.description: Optional. Short description of the result

thumbnail_url.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

InlineQueryResultPhoto.title: InlineQueryResultPhoto
InlineQueryResultPhoto.description: Represents a link to a photo. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

type.description: Type of the result, must be photo

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

photo_url.description: A valid URL of the photo. Photo must be in JPEG format. Photo size must not exceed 5MB

thumbnail_url.description: URL of the thumbnail for the photo

description.description: Optional. Short description of the result

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the photo

InlineQueryResultGif.title: InlineQueryResultGif
InlineQueryResultGif.description: Represents a link to an animated GIF file. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

type.description: Type of the result, must be gif

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

gif_url.description: A valid URL for the GIF file

gif_duration.description: Optional. Duration of the GIF in seconds

thumbnail_url.description: URL of the static (JPEG or GIF) or animated (MPEG4) thumbnail for the result

thumbnail_mime_type.description: Optional. MIME type of the thumbnail, must be one of "image/jpeg", "image/gif", or "video/mp4". Defaults to "image/jpeg"

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the GIF file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the GIF animation

InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif.title: InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif
InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif.description: Represents a link to a video animation (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound). By default, this animated MPEG-4 file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

type.description: Type of the result, must be mpeg4_gif

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

mpeg4_url.description: A valid URL for the MPEG4 file

thumbnail_url.description: URL of the static (JPEG or GIF) or animated (MPEG4) thumbnail for the result

thumbnail_mime_type.description: Optional. MIME type of the thumbnail, must be one of "image/jpeg", "image/gif", or "video/mp4". Defaults to "image/jpeg"

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the MPEG-4 file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation

InlineQueryResultVideo.title: InlineQueryResultVideo
InlineQueryResultVideo.description: Represents a link to a page containing an embedded video player or a video file. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

type.description: Type of the result, must be video

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

video_url.description: A valid URL for the embedded video player or video file

mime_type.description: MIME type of the content of the video URL, "text/html" or "video/mp4"

thumbnail_url.description: URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the video

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

description.description: Optional. Short description of the result

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video. This field is required if InlineQueryResultVideo is used to send an HTML-page as a result (e.g., a YouTube video).

InlineQueryResultAudio.title: InlineQueryResultAudio
InlineQueryResultAudio.description: Represents a link to an MP3 audio file. By default, this audio file will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the audio.

type.description: Type of the result, must be audio

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

audio_url.description: A valid URL for the audio file

caption.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio

InlineQueryResultVoice.title: InlineQueryResultVoice
InlineQueryResultVoice.description: Represents a link to a voice recording in an .OGG container encoded with OPUS. By default, this voice recording will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the the voice message.

type.description: Type of the result, must be voice

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

voice_url.description: A valid URL for the voice recording

caption.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the voice recording

InlineQueryResultDocument.title: InlineQueryResultDocument
InlineQueryResultDocument.description: Represents a link to a file. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the file. Currently, only .PDF and .ZIP files can be sent using this method.

type.description: Type of the result, must be document

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

document_url.description: A valid URL for the file

mime_type.description: MIME type of the content of the file, either "application/pdf" or "application/zip"

description.description: Optional. Short description of the result

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the file

thumbnail_url.description: Optional. URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the file

InlineQueryResultLocation.title: InlineQueryResultLocation
InlineQueryResultLocation.description: Represents a location on a map. By default, the location will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the location.

type.description: Type of the result, must be location

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

horizontal_accuracy.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

live_period.description: Optional. Period in seconds during which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400, or 0x7FFFFFFF for live locations that can be edited indefinitely.

heading.description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

proximity_alert_radius.description: Optional. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the location

thumbnail_url.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

InlineQueryResultVenue.title: InlineQueryResultVenue
InlineQueryResultVenue.description: Represents a venue. By default, the venue will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the venue.

type.description: Type of the result, must be venue

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

latitude.description: Latitude of the venue location in degrees

longitude.description: Longitude of the venue location in degrees

foursquare_id.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue if known

foursquare_type.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, "arts_entertainment/default", "arts_entertainment/aquarium" or "food/icecream".)

google_place_id.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

google_place_type.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the venue

thumbnail_url.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

InlineQueryResultContact.title: InlineQueryResultContact
InlineQueryResultContact.description: Represents a contact with a phone number. By default, this contact will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the contact.

type.description: Type of the result, must be contact

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

vcard.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard, 0-2048 bytes

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the contact

thumbnail_url.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

type.description: Type of the result, must be game

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto.title: InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto
InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto.description: Represents a link to a photo stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

type.description: Type of the result, must be photo

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

photo_file_id.description: A valid file identifier of the photo

description.description: Optional. Short description of the result

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the photo

InlineQueryResultCachedGif.title: InlineQueryResultCachedGif
InlineQueryResultCachedGif.description: Represents a link to an animated GIF file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with specified content instead of the animation.

type.description: Type of the result, must be gif

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

gif_file_id.description: A valid file identifier for the GIF file

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the GIF file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the GIF animation

InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif.title: InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif
InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif.description: Represents a link to a video animation (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound) stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this animated MPEG-4 file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

type.description: Type of the result, must be mpeg4_gif

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

mpeg4_file_id.description: A valid file identifier for the MPEG4 file

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the MPEG-4 file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation

InlineQueryResultCachedSticker.title: InlineQueryResultCachedSticker
InlineQueryResultCachedSticker.description: Represents a link to a sticker stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this sticker will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the sticker.

type.description: Type of the result, must be sticker

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

sticker_file_id.description: A valid file identifier of the sticker

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the sticker

InlineQueryResultCachedDocument.title: InlineQueryResultCachedDocument
InlineQueryResultCachedDocument.description: Represents a link to a file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the file.

type.description: Type of the result, must be document

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

document_file_id.description: A valid file identifier for the file

description.description: Optional. Short description of the result

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the file

InlineQueryResultCachedVideo.title: InlineQueryResultCachedVideo
InlineQueryResultCachedVideo.description: Represents a link to a video file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

type.description: Type of the result, must be video

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

video_file_id.description: A valid file identifier for the video file

description.description: Optional. Short description of the result

caption.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

show_caption_above_media.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video

InlineQueryResultCachedVoice.title: InlineQueryResultCachedVoice
InlineQueryResultCachedVoice.description: Represents a link to a voice message stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this voice message will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the voice message.

type.description: Type of the result, must be voice

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

voice_file_id.description: A valid file identifier for the voice message

caption.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the voice message

InlineQueryResultCachedAudio.title: InlineQueryResultCachedAudio
InlineQueryResultCachedAudio.description: Represents a link to an MP3 audio file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this audio file will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the audio.

type.description: Type of the result, must be audio

id.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

audio_file_id.description: A valid file identifier for the audio file

caption.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See formatting options for more details.

caption_entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

reply_markup.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

input_message_content.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio

InputMessageContent.title: InputMessageContent
InputMessageContent.description:
This object represents the content of a message to be sent as a result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support the following 5 types:
- InputTextMessageContent
- InputLocationMessageContent
- InputVenueMessageContent
- InputContactMessageContent
- InputInvoiceMessageContent

InputTextMessageContent.title: InputTextMessageContent
InputTextMessageContent.description: Represents the content of a text message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

message_text.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters

parse_mode.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.

entities.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

link_preview_options.description: Optional. Link preview generation options for the message

InputLocationMessageContent.title: InputLocationMessageContent
InputLocationMessageContent.description: Represents the content of a location message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

latitude.description: Latitude of the location in degrees

longitude.description: Longitude of the location in degrees

horizontal_accuracy.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

live_period.description: Optional. Period in seconds during which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400, or 0x7FFFFFFF for live locations that can be edited indefinitely.

heading.description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

proximity_alert_radius.description: Optional. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

InputVenueMessageContent.title: InputVenueMessageContent
InputVenueMessageContent.description: Represents the content of a venue message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

latitude.description: Latitude of the venue in degrees

longitude.description: Longitude of the venue in degrees

foursquare_id.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue, if known

foursquare_type.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, "arts_entertainment/default", "arts_entertainment/aquarium" or "food/icecream".)

google_place_id.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

google_place_type.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

InputContactMessageContent.title: InputContactMessageContent
InputContactMessageContent.description: Represents the content of a contact message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

vcard.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard, 0-2048 bytes

InputInvoiceMessageContent.title: InputInvoiceMessageContent
